@evanhindra And after I got the HE-6 and compared them back-to-back, my SR-009 sat in my closet, unused, until I sold it a few weeks later.
@evanhindra Right. You give up a lot with ‚Äòstats: price, reliability, availability, any other amps, convenience, bass. Orthos offer it all.
@evanhindra Orthos are a better technology than ‚Äòstats: simpler, more reliable, work with normal amps and low voltage, and better bass.
@evanhindra People romanticize electrostatics as the best technology, but in reality, modern orthos can be better than modern ‚Äòstats.
@evanhindra The way the HE-6 is the genre master, the SR-009 is the opposite: only some music sounds great on it.

@evanhindra People romanticize tubes, and they do look cool and old-timey. But they‚Äôre also a pain in the ass. Solid-state is pretty great.

@evanhindra I think people like the look of tubes more than the reality of tubes. But don‚Äôt tell anyone I said that.
@evanhindra And the stock/built-in stuff is usually fine.
@evanhindra What audiophiles can‚Äôt accept is that the majority of a modern digital source chain is pretty damn good for very little money.
@evanhindra Headphones matter a lot. Amps can matter, but only sometimes. DACs and cables hardly matter at all unless they‚Äôre REALLY shitty.
@evanhindra They can‚Äôt accept that a $1500 headphone may only need a $100 amp connected to a computer‚Äôs built-in DAC with a $1 cable.
@evanhindra And then when they get there, they just look at what‚Äôs next and start upgrading to the next price level.
@evanhindra People get upgradeitis. They convince themselves that all of their components deserve to be in the same price bracket.
